Choice.Tooltip: Submitted ionic forms are converted to their neutral forms (adding or removing protons) and their pKa is calculated.
The pKa of ionic forms are calculated, not their conjugated acids or bases.

Number.Label: Min basic pKa
Number.Tooltip: Widens the calculation range because weak bases will have lower pKa values than the default -10.

Number.Label: Max acidic pKa
Number.Tooltip: Widens the calculation range because weak acids will have higher pKa values than the default 20.

Boolean.Label: Show distribution chart
Boolean.Tooltip: Checking this box, you will have microspecies/macrospecies distribution as function of pH calculated and displayed. If not, only the pKa of the drawn molecule will be calculated.

Boolean.Label: Use correction library
Boolean.Tooltip: Check this box to use a file with experimental data for the calculation.

SingleSelection.Label: Correction library
SingleSelection.Tooltip: Select the user defined correction library.

Boolean.Label: Keep explicit hydrogens
Boolean.Tooltip: Keep explicit hydrogens on result molecule.
